channel.title: BBC News - Business
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Air travel yet to meaningfully restart, says UK industry
item.description: Bookings have not recovered due to the "frustrating" traffic light system, a trade group says.

item.title: Ministers consider blocking China's role in UK nuclear power
item.description: The move, amid rising tensions with Beijing, could impact the development of a plant in Suffolk.

item.title: Tesco Bank to close all its current accounts
item.description: The bank says most of the accounts have limited activity and are not being used.

item.title: Amazon Bitcoin job ad boosts cryptocurrency surge
item.description: News Amazon is hiring a digital-currency expert has helped boost the value of Bitcoin.

item.title: Marlboro maker Philip Morris could stop selling cigarettes in UK
item.description: Health charity Ash said it was hard to take such claims seriously from a cigarette manufacturer.

item.title: Covid: 'I earned less, but spent the same'
item.description: A new Couch to Financial Fitness programme aims to help people organise their finances post-pandemic.

item.title: Shares in Chinese online tutoring firms slump after shake-up
item.description: It is one of the biggest ever overhauls of China's $120bn private tutoring industry.

item.title: Tencent shares slide after Beijing crackdown on music rights
item.description: China's market watchdog said the technology giant broke the country's anti-competition rules.

item.title: Government pingdemic response chaotic, say food supply firms
item.description: Supply firms are having to fight to keep food on supermarket shelves, an industry body warns.

item.title: The experiences replacing closed High Street stores
item.description: Go-karts, bowling alleys and eateries have taken the place of closed retailers on the High Street.

item.title: Daily tests not self-isolation for police, fire, borders, transport and freight staff
item.description: Police, fire, borders and transport staff are now eligible in England, with 200 new test centres promised.

item.title: Covid: The holidaymakers having to self-isolate abroad
item.description: Some holidaymakers who tested positive for Covid while abroad are having to stay and self-isolate.

item.title: Covid: Food exemption scheme delayed until Monday
item.description: Iceland warns the move will not solve the issue of staff shortages in supermarkets themselves.

item.title: Rural vacuum for getting hold of cash
item.description: People living in rural areas have less chance of withdrawing or depositing cash nearby, research finds.

item.title: Covid: New testing plan will not work, warn firms
item.description: Industry body the CBI criticises government plans that allow some key staff to bypass the NHS Covid app.

item.title: Firm fined Â£2.6m for claiming clothes prevent Covid
item.description: Australian activewear company Lorna Jane is branded "exploitative" and "predatory" by a judge.

item.title: Rail services face cuts as staff self-isolate
item.description: Operators say they may have to run fewer trains as more employees are hit by the "pingdemic".

item.title: How global conferences are using tech to stay in business
item.description: Moving events online kept the industry going during the pandemic and now they're here to stay.

item.title: Heatwave: The worst jobs to have when temperatures soar
item.description: Not all jobs are equal when it comes to working in extreme heat, but which are the worst?

item.title: Is there a solution to the hospitality staff crisis?
item.description: Aside from Covid and Brexit, are there other reasons for the shortage of hospitality workers?

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'Four-day weeks are good for business'
item.description: CEO Joe Munns says giving his workers a three-day weekend makes them happier and more productive.

item.title: The little tech firm gunning for an airspeed record
item.description: Electroflight has built the E-NXT which it hopes will break the electric airspeed record.

item.title: Using plastic waste to help solve sand shortages
item.description: With construction sand in short supply crushed plastic is being used as an alternative.
